cosmology.title: Cosmological Regions
cosmology.description: The world is divided into distinct regions, including The Hill, The Water, and lands across The Water, which are considered separate and distinct from each other.

source_passages.text: Not a nasty, dirty, wet hole, filled with the ends of worms and an oozy smell, nor yet a dry, bare, sandy hole with nothing in it to sit down on or to eat: it was a hobbit-hole, and that means comfort
He may have lost the neighbours’ respect, but he gained — well, you will see whether he gained anything in the end.

Bungo, that was Bilbo’s father, built the most luxurious hobbit-hole for her (and partly with her money) that was to be found either under The Hill or over The Hill or across The Water, and there they

By some curious chance one morning long ago in the quiet of the world, when there was less noise and more green, and the hobbits were still numerous and prosperous, and Bilbo Baggins was standing at h
The sun was shining, and the grass was very green.

cosmology.title: Moon Cycles
cosmology.description: There are multiple moons in the world, which are visible in different lands and regions.

source_passages.text: Not a nasty, dirty, wet hole, filled with the ends of worms and an oozy smell, nor yet a dry, bare, sandy hole with nothing in it to sit down on or to eat: it was a hobbit-hole, and that means comfort
He may have lost the neighbours’ respect, but he gained — well, you will see whether he gained anything in the end.

Bungo, that was Bilbo’s father, built the most luxurious hobbit-hole for her (and partly with her money) that was to be found either under The Hill or over The Hill or across The Water, and there they

By some curious chance one morning long ago in the quiet of the world, when there was less noise and more green, and the hobbits were still numerous and prosperous, and Bilbo Baggins was standing at h
The sun was shining, and the grass was very green.

themes.title: Respectability and Adventure
themes.description: Respectability is associated with a lack of adventure and unexpected behavior.

source_passages.text: Not a nasty, dirty, wet hole, filled with the ends of worms and an oozy smell, nor yet a dry, bare, sandy hole with nothing in it to sit down on or to eat: it was a hobbit-hole, and that means comfort

The door opened on to a tube-shaped hall like a tunnel: a very comfortable tunnel without smoke, with panelled walls, and floors tiled and carpeted, provided with polished chairs, and lots and lots of
The best rooms were all on the left-hand side (going in), for these were the only ones to have windows, deep-set round windows looking over his garden, and meadows beyond, sloping down to the river.

The Bagginses had lived in the neighbourhood of The Hill for time out of mind, and people considered them very respectable, not only because most of them were rich, but also because they never had any
This is a story of how a Baggins had an adventure, and found himself doing and saying things altogether unexpected.

exceptions: The Tooks, who are richer but less respectable than the Bagginses

themes.title: Hobbit Physical Characteristics
themes.description: Hobbits are inclined to be fat in the stomach, have curly brown hair, long clever brown fingers, and natural leathery soles on their feet.

source_passages.text: Not a nasty, dirty, wet hole, filled with the ends of worms and an oozy smell, nor yet a dry, bare, sandy hole with nothing in it to sit down on or to eat: it was a hobbit-hole, and that means comfort

The door opened on to a tube-shaped hall like a tunnel: a very comfortable tunnel without smoke, with panelled walls, and floors tiled and carpeted, provided with polished chairs, and lots and lots of
The best rooms were all on the left-hand side (going in), for these were the only ones to have windows, deep-set round windows looking over his garden, and meadows beyond, sloping down to the river.

The Bagginses had lived in the neighbourhood of The Hill for time out of mind, and people considered them very respectable, not only because most of them were rich, but also because they never had any
This is a story of how a Baggins had an adventure, and found himself doing and saying things altogether unexpected.

themes.title: Hobbit Attire
themes.description: Hobbits dress in bright colors, chiefly green and yellow, and wear no shoes.

source_passages.text: Not a nasty, dirty, wet hole, filled with the ends of worms and an oozy smell, nor yet a dry, bare, sandy hole with nothing in it to sit down on or to eat: it was a hobbit-hole, and that means comfort

The best rooms were all on the left-hand side (going in), for these were the only ones to have windows, deep-set round windows looking over his garden, and meadows beyond, sloping down to the river.

The Bagginses had lived in the neighbourhood of The Hill for time out of mind, and people considered them very respectable, not only because most of them were rich, but also because they never had any
This is a story of how a Baggins had an adventure, and found himself doing and saying things altogether unexpected.

themes.title: Hobbit Values
themes.description: Hobbits value comfort, quietness, and plainness, and have no use for adventures.

source_passages.text: Not a nasty, dirty, wet hole, filled with the ends of worms and an oozy smell, nor yet a dry, bare, sandy hole with nothing in it to sit down on or to eat: it was a hobbit-hole, and that means comfort

The best rooms were all on the left-hand side (going in), for these were the only ones to have windows, deep-set round windows looking over his garden, and meadows beyond, sloping down to the river.

The Bagginses had lived in the neighbourhood of The Hill for time out of mind, and people considered them very respectable, not only because most of them were rich, but also because they never had any
This is a story of how a Baggins had an adventure, and found himself doing and saying things altogether unexpected.

exceptions: Bilbo Baggins, who eventually has an adventure

themes.title: Family Influence on Personality
themes.description: A hobbit's personality can be influenced by their family background, with traits from one side of the family potentially emerging later in life.

source_passages.text: Not a nasty, dirty, wet hole, filled with the ends of worms and an oozy smell, nor yet a dry, bare, sandy hole with nothing in it to sit down on or to eat: it was a hobbit-hole, and that means comfort

The door opened on to a tube-shaped hall like a tunnel: a very comfortable tunnel without smoke, with panelled walls, and floors tiled and carpeted, provided with polished chairs, and lots and lots of
The best rooms were all on the left-hand side (going in), for these were the only ones to have windows, deep-set round windows looking over his garden, and meadows beyond, sloping down to the river.

The Bagginses had lived in the neighbourhood of The Hill for time out of mind, and people considered them very respectable, not only because most of them were rich, but also because they never had any
This is a story of how a Baggins had an adventure, and found himself doing and saying things altogether unexpected.

geography.title: Hillside Tunnel Layout
geography.description: Tunnels in hills can have multiple round doors opening out of them on either side, and can be fairly but not quite straight.

source_passages.text: The tunnel wound on and on, going fairly but not quite straight into the side of the hill — The Hill, as all the people for many miles round called it — and many little round doors opened out of it, f

No going upstairs for the hobbit: bedrooms, bathrooms, cellars, pantries (lots of these), wardrobes (he had whole rooms devoted to clothes), kitchens, dining-rooms, all were on the same floor, and ind
The best rooms were all on the left-hand side (going in), for these were the only ones to have windows, deep-set round windows looking over his garden, and meadows beyond, sloping down to the river.

There is little or no magic about them, except the ordinary everyday sort which helps them to disappear quietly and quickly when large stupid folk like you and me come blundering along, making a noise

As I was saying, the mother of this hobbit — of Bilbo Baggins, that is — was the famous Belladonna Took, one of the three remarkable daughters of the Old Took, head of the hobbits who lived across The

geography.title: Hobbit-Hole Architecture
geography.description: Hobbit-holes have all rooms on the same floor and passage, with the best rooms typically having windows on one side.

source_passages.text: The tunnel wound on and on, going fairly but not quite straight into the side of the hill — The Hill, as all the people for many miles round called it — and many little round doors opened out of it, f

No going upstairs for the hobbit: bedrooms, bathrooms, cellars, pantries (lots of these), wardrobes (he had whole rooms devoted to clothes), kitchens, dining-rooms, all were on the same floor, and ind
The best rooms were all on the left-hand side (going in), for these were the only ones to have windows, deep-set round windows looking over his garden, and meadows beyond, sloping down to the river.

There is little or no magic about them, except the ordinary everyday sort which helps them to disappear quietly and quickly when large stupid folk like you and me come blundering along, making a noise

As I was saying, the mother of this hobbit — of Bilbo Baggins, that is — was the famous Belladonna Took, one of the three remarkable daughters of the Old Took, head of the hobbits who lived across The

constraints: typically on the left-hand side (going in)

geography.title: River and Hill Relationship
geography.description: Rivers can run at the foot of hills.

geography.title: Mountain and Cavern Layout
geography.description: Mountains can have hidden passages and caverns.

geography.title: Mountain and Dragon Relationship
geography.description: Mountains can be inhabited by dragons.

geography.title: Map Representation
geography.description: Maps can represent hidden passages and doors, and can be marked with runes.

language.title: Naming Convention for Places
language.description: Places are often referred to with a definite article, such as 'The Hill'.

source_passages.text: The tunnel wound on and on, going fairly but not quite straight into the side of the hill — The Hill, as all the people for many miles round called it — and many little round doors opened out of it, f
This hobbit was a very well-to-do hobbit, and his name was Baggins.
I suppose hobbits need some description nowadays, since they have become rare and shy of the Big People, as they call us.
Let me see, I don’t think I know your name?”
“Yes, yes, my dear sir — and I do know your name, Mr. Bilbo Baggins.

language.title: Use of Titles and Honorifics
language.description: Titles such as 'Mr.' are used as a sign of respect, and names are often accompanied by a title.

source_passages.text: The tunnel wound on and on, going fairly but not quite straight into the side of the hill — The Hill, as all the people for many miles round called it — and many little round doors opened out of it, f
This hobbit was a very well-to-do hobbit, and his name was Baggins.
I suppose hobbits need some description nowadays, since they have become rare and shy of the Big People, as they call us.
Let me see, I don’t think I know your name?”
“Yes, yes, my dear sir — and I do know your name, Mr. Bilbo Baggins.

language.title: Dwarvish Naming Pattern
language.description: Dwarves have names that follow a specific pattern, such as Dori, Nori, Ori, Oin, and Gloin.

source_passages.text: The tunnel wound on and on, going fairly but not quite straight into the side of the hill — The Hill, as all the people for many miles round called it — and many little round doors opened out of it, f
This hobbit was a very well-to-do hobbit, and his name was Baggins.
I suppose hobbits need some description nowadays, since they have become rare and shy of the Big People, as they call us.
Let me see, I don’t think I know your name?”
“Yes, yes, my dear sir — and I do know your name, Mr. Bilbo Baggins.

language.title: Runic Writing
language.description: Runes are used to convey messages and mark hidden passages, and can be used to provide information about the size of doors and passages.

source_passages.text: The tunnel wound on and on, going fairly but not quite straight into the side of the hill — The Hill, as all the people for many miles round called it — and many little round doors opened out of it, f
This hobbit was a very well-to-do hobbit, and his name was Baggins.
I suppose hobbits need some description nowadays, since they have become rare and shy of the Big People, as they call us.
Let me see, I don’t think I know your name?”
“Yes, yes, my dear sir — and I do know your name, Mr. Bilbo Baggins.

constraints: Runes must be decipherable to be useful.

language.title: Formal Speech and Toasts
language.description: Formal speech and toasts often involve praising the host and their hospitality, and may include blessings or good wishes.

source_passages.text: The tunnel wound on and on, going fairly but not quite straight into the side of the hill — The Hill, as all the people for many miles round called it — and many little round doors opened out of it, f
This hobbit was a very well-to-do hobbit, and his name was Baggins.
I suppose hobbits need some description nowadays, since they have become rare and shy of the Big People, as they call us.
Let me see, I don’t think I know your name?”
“Yes, yes, my dear sir — and I do know your name, Mr. Bilbo Baggins.

history.title: Hobbit Architecture
history.description: Hobbit homes are typically built on one floor with all rooms accessible from the same passage.

source_passages.text: No going upstairs for the hobbit: bedrooms, bathrooms, cellars, pantries (lots of these), wardrobes (he had whole rooms devoted to clothes), kitchens, dining-rooms, all were on the same floor, and ind

The Bagginses had lived in the neighbourhood of The Hill for time out of mind, and people considered them very respectable, not only because most of them were rich, but also because they never had any

They are inclined to be fat in the stomach; they dress in bright colours (chiefly green and yellow); wear no shoes, because their feet grow natural leathery soles and thick warm brown hair like the st
It was often said (in other families) that long ago one of the Took ancestors must have taken a fairy wife.

The chance never arrived, until Bilbo Baggins was grown up, being about fifty years old or so, and living in the beautiful hobbit-hole built by his father, which I have just described for you, until h

history.title: Hobbit Family History
history.description: Hobbit families, such as the Bagginses, have lived in the same neighborhood for a very long time, often for 'time out of mind'.

history.title: Hobbit Longevity
history.description: Hobbits can live to be around 50 years old or more, as evidenced by Bilbo Baggins' age.

history.title: Dwarven Song and History
history.description: Dwarves have a rich history of crafting and shaping treasures, including golden hoards and gems on sword hilts, which is reflected in their songs.

creatures.title: Hobbit Physical Characteristics
creatures.description: Hobbits are small in stature, about half the height of regular people, and have no beards.

source_passages.text: They are (or were) a little people, about half our height, and smaller than the bearded Dwarves.
Hobbits have no beards.
That was, of course, absurd, but certainly there was still something not entirely hobbitlike about them, and once in a while members of the Took-clan would go and have adventures.
He had a tall pointed blue hat, a long grey cloak, a silver scarf over which his long white beard hung down below his waist, and immense black boots.
Not the fellow who used to tell such wonderful tales at parties, about dragons and goblins and giants and the rescue of princesses and the unexpected luck of widows’ sons?

creatures.title: Dwarf Physical Characteristics
creatures.description: Dwarves are bearded and can have varying colors of beards.

creatures.title: Dragon Behavior
creatures.description: Dragons are attracted to fire and can be woken by loud noises.

creatures.title: Dragon Habitat
creatures.description: Dragons can breed in specific locations, such as the Withered Heath.

magic.title: Magic Staff Properties
magic.description: A wizard's staff can be used to create various magical effects, such as scratching signs, creating light, and producing smoke rings.

source_passages.text: There is little or no magic about them, except the ordinary everyday sort which helps them to disappear quietly and quickly when large stupid folk like you and me come blundering along, making a noise
All that the unsuspecting Bilbo saw that morning was an old man with a staff.
Not the wandering wizard that gave Old Took a pair of magic diamond studs that fastened themselves and never came undone till ordered?
“Where else should I be?” said the wizard. “All the same I am pleased to find you remember something about me.
Wizards after all are wizards.

magic.title: Magic Diamond Studs
magic.description: Magic diamond studs can fasten themselves and remain fastened until ordered to come undone.

source_passages.text: There is little or no magic about them, except the ordinary everyday sort which helps them to disappear quietly and quickly when large stupid folk like you and me come blundering along, making a noise
All that the unsuspecting Bilbo saw that morning was an old man with a staff.
Not the wandering wizard that gave Old Took a pair of magic diamond studs that fastened themselves and never came undone till ordered?
“Where else should I be?” said the wizard. “All the same I am pleased to find you remember something about me.
Wizards after all are wizards.

magic.title: Dwarven Magic
magic.description: Dwarves can create mighty spells, often in conjunction with their craftsmanship and magical abilities.

source_passages.text: There is little or no magic about them, except the ordinary everyday sort which helps them to disappear quietly and quickly when large stupid folk like you and me come blundering along, making a noise
All that the unsuspecting Bilbo saw that morning was an old man with a staff.
Not the wandering wizard that gave Old Took a pair of magic diamond studs that fastened themselves and never came undone till ordered?
“Where else should I be?” said the wizard. “All the same I am pleased to find you remember something about me.
Wizards after all are wizards.

constraints: Requires dwarven craftsmanship and magical abilities

magic.title: Wizardly Abilities
magic.description: Wizards possess unique magical abilities, such as creating light, producing smoke rings, and perceiving hidden things.

source_passages.text: There is little or no magic about them, except the ordinary everyday sort which helps them to disappear quietly and quickly when large stupid folk like you and me come blundering along, making a noise
All that the unsuspecting Bilbo saw that morning was an old man with a staff.
Not the wandering wizard that gave Old Took a pair of magic diamond studs that fastened themselves and never came undone till ordered?
“Where else should I be?” said the wizard. “All the same I am pleased to find you remember something about me.
Wizards after all are wizards.

magic.title: Magic Entrance Concealment
magic.description: Magical entrances can be concealed from non-magical observers, requiring a wizard or other magical means to reveal them.

source_passages.text: There is little or no magic about them, except the ordinary everyday sort which helps them to disappear quietly and quickly when large stupid folk like you and me come blundering along, making a noise
All that the unsuspecting Bilbo saw that morning was an old man with a staff.
Not the wandering wizard that gave Old Took a pair of magic diamond studs that fastened themselves and never came undone till ordered?
“Where else should I be?” said the wizard. “All the same I am pleased to find you remember something about me.
Wizards after all are wizards.

technology.title: Fireworks Technology
technology.description: Fireworks can be made, and they can be particularly excellent.

source_passages.text: Still it is probable that Bilbo, her only son, although he looked and behaved exactly like a second edition of his solid and comfortable father, got something a bit queer in his make-up from the Took
He had a tall pointed blue hat, a long grey cloak, a silver scarf over which his long white beard hung down below his waist, and immense black boots.
Make you late for dinner!
Not the man that used to make such particularly excellent fireworks!
Anything from climbing trees to visiting elves — or sailing in ships, sailing to other shores!

technology.title: Metalworking and Crafting
technology.description: Dwarves can craft and shape metal objects, such as golden belts, silver belts, and golden harps.

source_passages.text: Still it is probable that Bilbo, her only son, although he looked and behaved exactly like a second edition of his solid and comfortable father, got something a bit queer in his make-up from the Took
He had a tall pointed blue hat, a long grey cloak, a silver scarf over which his long white beard hung down below his waist, and immense black boots.
Make you late for dinner!
Not the man that used to make such particularly excellent fireworks!
Anything from climbing trees to visiting elves — or sailing in ships, sailing to other shores!

technology.title: Tool Use
technology.description: Dwarves use tools, such as spades, and carry bags of tools.

source_passages.text: Still it is probable that Bilbo, her only son, although he looked and behaved exactly like a second edition of his solid and comfortable father, got something a bit queer in his make-up from the Took

technology.title: Shipbuilding and Navigation
technology.description: Ships can be built, and people can sail to other shores.

source_passages.text: There is little or no magic about them, except the ordinary everyday sort which helps them to disappear quietly and quickly when large stupid folk like you and me come blundering along, making a noise
All that the unsuspecting Bilbo saw that morning was an old man with a staff.
Not the wandering wizard that gave Old Took a pair of magic diamond studs that fastened themselves and never came undone till ordered?
“Where else should I be?” said the wizard. “All the same I am pleased to find you remember something about me.
Wizards after all are wizards.
After a while he stepped up, and with the spike on his staff scratched a queer sign on the hobbit’s beautiful green front-door.
And there was Gandalf behind, leaning on his staff and laughing.
Then Gandalf’s smoke-ring would go green and come back to hover over the wizard’s head.
Far over the misty mountains cold To dungeons deep and caverns old We must away ere break of day To seek the pale enchanted gold.
The dwarves of yore made mighty spells, While hammers fell like ringing bells In places deep, where dark things sleep, In hollow halls beneath the fells.
